characters.name: Alice
characters.description: A young girl who is the main character, curious and imaginative.

characters.name: Dinah
characters.description: The old cat who washes the kittens' faces.

characters.name: Kitty
characters.description: A mischievous kitten that Alice talks to.

characters.name: Snowdrop
characters.description: A kitten that was having its face washed by Dinah.

characters.name: Alice's sister
characters.description: Alice's sister who likes being very exact.

characters.name: Nurse
characters.description: Alice's old nurse who was frightened by Alice's pretend game.

characters.name: Red Queen
characters.description: A chess piece that Alice imagines the kitten could resemble.

characters.name: White Queen
characters.description: A chess piece that is concerned about her child, Lily.

characters.name: White King
characters.description: A chess piece who is puzzled and unhappy.

characters.name: Lily
characters.description: The White Queen's child, a pawn that was squeaking.

characters.name: Jabberwock
characters.description: A creature mentioned in the poem 'Jabberwocky'.

characters.name: Jabberwocky's son
characters.description: The son who slays the Jabberwock in the poem.

characters.name: Tiger-lily
characters.description: A talking flower that interacts with Alice.

characters.name: Rose
characters.description: A talking flower that comments on Alice's appearance.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.description: A group of talking flowers that speak in unison.

characters.name: Violet
characters.description: A talking flower that makes a sudden remark about Alice.

characters.name: Guard
characters.description: A guard on the train who checks tickets.

characters.name: Gentleman in white paper
characters.description: A gentleman dressed in white paper sitting opposite Alice.

characters.name: Goat
characters.description: A goat sitting next to the gentleman in white.

characters.name: Beetle
characters.description: A beetle sitting next to the Goat.

characters.name: Horse
characters.description: A horse that speaks with a hoarse voice.

characters.name: Gnat
characters.description: A large gnat that talks to Alice.

characters.name: Fawn
characters.description: A gentle fawn that Alice encounters in the wood.

characters.name: Tweedledum
characters.description: One of the two brothers, known for his argumentative nature and involvement in a quarrel over a rattle.

characters.name: Tweedledee
characters.description: The other brother, who often contradicts Tweedledum and participates in their antics.

characters.name: The Red King
characters.description: A character who is sleeping and dreaming, mentioned by Tweedledum and Tweedledee.

characters.name: The Walrus
characters.description: A character in the poem recited by Tweedledee, known for eating oysters.

characters.name: The Carpenter
characters.description: Another character in the poem, who accompanies the Walrus and also eats oysters.

characters.name: The Oysters
characters.description: Characters in the poem who are invited by the Walrus and the Carpenter.

characters.name: The White Queen
characters.description: A queen who appears disorganized and has a peculiar way of thinking, living backwards.

characters.name: The Sheep
characters.description: An old sheep who knits and runs a shop, appearing after the White Queen.

characters.name: The King's Messenger
characters.description: A character mentioned by the White Queen, who is in prison and awaiting trial.

characters.name: Humpty Dumpty
characters.description: A character resembling an egg, sitting on a wall, known for his fall.

characters.name: The King
characters.description: A king mentioned by Humpty Dumpty, who promised to send his horses and men.

characters.name: The White King and Queen
characters.description: Royal figures who gave Humpty Dumpty a cravat as an un-birthday present.

characters.name: Haigha
characters.description: An Anglo-Saxon Messenger known for his happy attitudes and peculiar movements.

characters.name: Hatta
characters.description: The other messenger who is just out of prison and is very hungry and thirsty.

characters.name: Lion
characters.description: A creature involved in a fight with the Unicorn for the crown.

characters.name: Unicorn
characters.description: A creature fighting the Lion for the crown, known for his horn.

characters.name: Red Knight
characters.description: A knight dressed in crimson armor who claims Alice as his prisoner.

characters.name: White Knight
characters.description: A knight dressed in tin armor who rescues Alice and accompanies her.

characters.name: Red King
characters.description: Mentioned as a character whose dream Alice fears she might be part of.

characters.name: Anglo-Saxon Messengers
characters.description: Mentioned as part of Alice's dream.

characters.name: Knight
characters.description: A character with mild blue eyes and a kindly smile, who sings a ballad to Alice.

characters.name: Aged Man
characters.description: A character in the Knight's song, described as sitting on a gate and having a mild look.

characters.name: Frog
characters.description: An old frog who answers Alice at the door.

characters.name: Pudding
characters.description: A talking pudding that Alice interacts with during the feast.
